title: Germans don't like Trump withdrawing US troops from Germany.  "Yankee go home" - now they want us to stay? These people are unpleasable.  USA out of NATO!

body: I very seriously doubt the people who say "yankee go home" are the same people who don't want US troops to leave.
body_html: I very seriously doubt the people who say "yankee go home" are the same people who don't want US troops to leave.

post.title: Germans don't like Trump withdrawing US troops from Germany.  "Yankee go home" - now they want us to stay? These people are unpleasable.  USA out of NATO!

body:
That is the great thing about being European - you just find out what the Americans are doing and get on the other side.  If they want to stay, you demand they leave.  If they start to leave, you demand to know why they're violating their treaty agreements and leaving you naked to the Russians.  


>"America," wrote Grau, "represents just about everything that is frowned upon in this country: individualism, personal responsibility, skepticism toward the state, capitalism." But most offensive of all to Germans, Grau suggested, is "the idea of ​​freedom," which brings with it "competition instead of a comfortable collective economy and dissent instead of cozy consensus."

https://www.cicero.de/aussenpolitik/antiamerikanismus-die-usa-muss-unsere-schutzmacht-bleiben/57507


I can see why they like it - it's the easiest position ever. You don't actually have to be *for* anything, just against.   Anti-Americanism is rampant in Europe for a reason.  It's popular among all segments of society - and if you actually find someone who's pro-American you've likely found a neo-nazi.

"America," wrote Grau, "represents just about everything that is frowned upon in this country: individualism, personal responsibility, skepticism toward the state, capitalism." But most offensive of all to Germans, Grau suggested, is "the idea of ​​freedom," which brings with it "competition instead of a comfortable collective economy and dissent instead of cozy consensus."

It's popular among all segments of society - and if you actually find someone who's pro-American you've likely found a neo-nazi.

post.title: Germans don't like Trump withdrawing US troops from Germany.  "Yankee go home" - now they want us to stay? These people are unpleasable.  USA out of NATO!

body:
Hold on, you actually seriously believe that one person can both complain about Americans troops being in their country, and at same time complain about American troops leaving? You actually think those are the same persons?

I think we're misunderstanding each other, I'm having a hard time comprehending how you could think that.
body_html:
Hold on, you actually seriously believe that one person can both complain about Americans troops being in their country, and at same time complain about American troops leaving? You actually think those are the same persons?

I think we're misunderstanding each other, I'm having a hard time comprehending how you could think that.

post.title: Germans don't like Trump withdrawing US troops from Germany.  "Yankee go home" - now they want us to stay? These people are unpleasable.  USA out of NATO!

body:
Sure!  Why not?  It is the essence of anti-Americanism.

To be an anti-American, you simply find out what the Americans are doing and take a contrary stance.  It's just that easy.

It is no stretch to imagine people flipping their positions to something ridiculous just so they can avoid being on the same side as the Americans.  Did you read the article I posted before?  It makes this exact point.

>West Germans knew America had saved them from Soviet conquest, and were (at first) thankful. But that gratitude eventually curdled into an "anti-American neurosis" that led them, in later years, to express "solidarity with the most obnoxious autocrats in the world," from Saddam to Assad, simply because they were America's enemies.

https://www.cicero.de/aussenpolitik/antiamerikanismus-die-usa-muss-unsere-schutzmacht-bleiben/57507
body_html:
Sure! Why not? It is the essence of anti-Americanism.

To be an anti-American, you simply find out what the Americans are doing and take a contrary stance. It's just that easy.

It is no stretch to imagine people flipping their positions to something ridiculous just so they can avoid being on the same side as the Americans. Did you read the article I posted before? It makes this exact point.

West Germans knew America had saved them from Soviet conquest, and were (at first) thankful. But that gratitude eventually curdled into an "anti-American neurosis" that led them, in later years, to express "solidarity with the most obnoxious autocrats in the world," from Saddam to Assad, simply because they were America's enemies.

https://www.cicero.de/aussenpolitik/antiamerikanismus-die-usa-muss-unsere-schutzmacht-bleiben/57507
